definitions.definition: To make fit for any use by time or habit; to habituate; to accustom; to inure.
definitions.example: to season oneself to a climate

definitions.definition: (by extension) To prepare by drying or hardening, or removal of natural juices.
definitions.example: The timber needs to be seasoned.

definitions.definition: To become mature; to grow fit for use; to become adapted to a climate.
To become dry and hard, by the escape of the natural juices, or by being penetrated with other substance.
definitions.example: The wood has seasoned in the sun.

definitions.definition: To mingle: to moderate, temper, or qualify by admixture.
To flavour food with spices, herbs or salt.
Experienced, especially in terms of a profession or a hobby
Of a food, often a liquid: containing seasonings
